## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm playing around with creating currencies in Verus, and I was wondering, is it possible to create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name?

**AI Assistant:**
I'd advise against that. While the protocol doesn't prevent it, it's not recommended and will likely cause problems. The ID's name should not be an encoded i-address. In fact, it's not supported for creating currencies.

**User:**
Okay, thanks for the warning. I was also thinking of creating a PBaaS chain with the name of a supported currency in the Verus Desktop, like BTC or ETH. Is that allowed?

**AI Assistant:**
Not in the current testnet release, I'm afraid. You can't use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a supported currency in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH. But don't worry, this limitation will be resolved before mainnet availability.

**User:**
Got it, thanks for clarifying. One more question: is the software provided with a warranty for any kind of damage that might occur?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the software is provided without a warranty for any kind of damage. It's explicitly stated that it's "experimental and unfinished software" and that users should "use at their own risk".
Is it possible to create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name?

No, it is not recommended to create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name. While the protocol does not prevent it, it will cause problems and is not supported for creating currencies.

### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage!

Can I use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a supported currency in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH?

No, in the current testnet release, you cannot use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a supported currency in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH. This limitation will be resolved before mainnet availability.
